content: I think this clash had been vandalized :(
This contribution hasn’t received enough positive votes from the community. The "FASTEST" option has therefore been deactivated.

The formula implemented in your code is wrong.
The formula for number of diagonals should look something like:
int numOfDiagonals = (N*(N-3))/2;
Reference: https://www.brightstorm.com/math/geometry/reasoning-diagonals-angles-and-parallel-lines/number-of-diagonals-in-a-polygon/#:~:text=The%20number%20of%20diagonals%20in,each%20diagonal%20is%20counted%20twice).

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: I accept this contribution because I believe that it will be a good problem to practice coding skills on.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: It's a nice problem that fits all rules

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Problem is fully functional, the description and contraints are clear and easy to read, and I had lots of fun solving the problem.

Please refer to the contribution guidelines here: https://www.codingame.com/playgrounds/40701/help-center/contribution-guidelines. In particular, please revise your puzzle so that it doesn't require binary output.
[Edit: The author has revised the puzzle.]

Consider that this is a circle with points, not a polygon. While the formula for the number of diagonals in a polygon is indeed (N*(N-3))/2, we also need to connect the points to each other in a manner that would be the sides of the polygon. There are N vertices and hence we must add N to the formula at the end, giving the diagonals of the circle, not the N-gon.
